summary: The Healthy Poultry Assistance and Indemnification Act of 2025 amends the Animal Health Protection Act to provide compensation to poultry growers and layers located within control areas declared by the Administrator of the Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service. The bill defines "poultry", establishes compensation based on average income from previous flocks, sets a 60-day payment timeframe, and details exceptions including provisions concerning compensation for destroyed animals. It aims to support poultry farmers financially when their operations are restricted due to disease control measures.
